required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chemotherapy for Patients With Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 3 Study of Pemetrexed Versus Docetaxel in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Who Have Had Prior Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy and toxicity of pemetrexed and docetaxel administered on a 3-weekly schedule in the treatment of patients with locally advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have had prior chemotherapy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 24 months after study enrollment); amendment (up to 30 months after study enrollment)
primary_outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from the date of study enrollment to the date of death due to any cause. Survival time was censored at the date of last contact for patients who were still alive or lost to follow-up. An amendment allowed for the collection of overall survival on an additional 43 survival events. At the time the original record was released, it was not possible to provide results with the 95% Confidence Interval (CI) since the upper limit was not calculable. The median and 95% CIs are now reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured tumor response (up to 24 months after study enrollment)
secondary_outcome.description: Response based on Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST), which define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR (complete response) = disappearance of all target lesions; PR (partial response) = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; PD (progressive disease) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; SD (stable disease) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 24 months after study enrollment)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival (PFS) time was defined as the time from the date of study enrollment to the date of the first of the following events: objective disease progression or death due to any cause. For patients who were alive and had not progressed, PFS was censored at the last contact.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time of response to progressive disease (up to 24 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of tumor response is the duration from date of first objective status assessment of a complete or partial response to the first date of progression or death from any cause. For each patient who is not known to have died or to have had a progression of disease as of the data inclusion cut-off date, duration of tumor response was censored at the time of last prior contact. Due to the low number of patients in the analysis, the median duration of tumor response could not be calculated for the docetaxel arm. Available data are presented as "Number of Patients with Disease Progression".

secondary_outcome.time_frame: first dose of study drug up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum common terminology criteria (CTC) Grade 3 or 4 toxicities possibly related to study drug are reported. The worst grade event per cycle is reported. Grades range from 0 (none) to 5 (death). Grade 3 events are severe and Grade 4 events are life-threatening.

intervention.description: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) every 21 days until disease progression, death or 12 months after enrollment
75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days until disease progression, death or 12 months after enrollment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologic or cytologic diagnosis NSCLC (Stage IIIA, IIIB, or IV), not amenable to curative surgery or radiotherapy
- At least one prior chemotherapy for palliative therapy
- Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria for disease status assessment
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0 to 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent administration of any other tumor therapy
- Pregnant or breast feeding
- Serious concomitant disorders
- Inability or unwillingness to take folic acid or vitamin B12 supplementation

measure.title: Disease Stage
measure.description: Stage means how big the tumor is and how far it has spread. Stages range from 0 (not spread) to IV (spread throughout the body). Stage IIIA - the cancer has spread to nearby tissue or spread to far away lymph nodes; Stage IIIB - cancer spread to opposite side of chest, more than one tumor within same lobe of lung; Stage IV - the cancer has spread to other organs of the body such as the other lung, brain, or liver.

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measure.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death).

measure.title: Number of Sites of Metastatic Disease

outcome.title: Overall Tumor Response
outcome.description: Response based on Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST), which define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR (complete response) = disappearance of all target lesions; PR (partial response) = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; PD (progressive disease) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; SD (stable disease) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured tumor response (up to 24 months after study enrollment)
outcome.population: Patients who received at least one dose of study drug and qualified for tumor response analysis (met following criteria: histologic or cytologic diagnosis of NSCLC that was not amenable to curative therapy; no concurrent systemic chemotherapy; presence of measurable or evaluable disease).

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) every 21 days until disease progression, death or 12 months after enrollment.

group.title: Docetaxel
group.description: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days until disease progression, death or 12 months after enrollment.

measure.title: Overall Tumor Response
measure.description: Response based on Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST), which define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. CR (complete response) = disappearance of all target lesions; PR (partial response) = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; PD (progressive disease) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; SD (stable disease) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.
measure.population: Patients who received at least one dose of study drug and qualified for tumor response analysis (met following criteria: histologic or cytologic diagnosis of NSCLC that was not amenable to curative therapy; no concurrent systemic chemotherapy; presence of measurable or evaluable disease).

analysis.p_value_desc: Logistic regression of best overall tumor response (complete response + partial response).

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Progression-free survival (PFS) time was defined as the time from the date of study enrollment to the date of the first of the following events: objective disease progression or death due to any cause. For patients who were alive and had not progressed, PFS was censored at the last contact.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 24 months after study enrollment)
outcome.population: Intent to treat population. Patient censored: pemetrexed=25, docetaxel=39.

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) every 21 days until disease progression, death or 12 months after enrollment.

group.title: Docetaxel
group.description: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days until disease progression, death or 12 months after enrollment.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: Progression-free survival (PFS) time was defined as the time from the date of study enrollment to the date of the first of the following events: objective disease progression or death due to any cause. For patients who were alive and had not progressed, PFS was censored at the last contact.
measure.population: Intent to treat population. Patient censored: pemetrexed=25, docetaxel=39.

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: Duration of tumor response is the duration from date of first objective status assessment of a complete or partial response to the first date of progression or death from any cause. For each patient who is not known to have died or to have had a progression of disease as of the data inclusion cut-off date, duration of tumor response was censored at the time of last prior contact. Due to the low number of patients in the analysis, the median duration of tumor response could not be calculated for the docetaxel arm. Available data are presented as "Number of Patients with Disease Progression".
outcome.time_frame: time of response to progressive disease (up to 24 months)
outcome.population: Patients who qualified for response (met following criteria: histologic or cytologic diagnosis of NSCLC that was not amenable to curative therapy; no concurrent systemic chemotherapy; presence of measurable or evaluable disease). Results not presented because median was not calculable for the docetaxel arm.

group.title: Docetaxel

measure.title: Duration of Response
measure.description: Duration of tumor response is the duration from date of first objective status assessment of a complete or partial response to the first date of progression or death from any cause. For each patient who is not known to have died or to have had a progression of disease as of the data inclusion cut-off date, duration of tumor response was censored at the time of last prior contact. Due to the low number of patients in the analysis, the median duration of tumor response could not be calculated for the docetaxel arm. Available data are presented as "Number of Patients with Disease Progression".
measure.population: Patients who qualified for response (met following criteria: histologic or cytologic diagnosis of NSCLC that was not amenable to curative therapy; no concurrent systemic chemotherapy; presence of measurable or evaluable disease). Results not presented because median was not calculable for the docetaxel arm.

outcome.title: Pharmacology Toxicity
outcome.description: Maximum common terminology criteria (CTC) Grade 3 or 4 toxicities possibly related to study drug are reported. The worst grade event per cycle is reported. Grades range from 0 (none) to 5 (death). Grade 3 events are severe and Grade 4 events are life-threatening.
outcome.time_frame: first dose of study drug up to 24 months
outcome.population: Patients who received at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from the date of study enrollment to the date of death due to any cause. Survival time was censored at the date of last contact for patients who were still alive or lost to follow-up. An amendment allowed for the collection of overall survival on an additional 43 survival events. At the time the original record was released, it was not possible to provide results with the 95% Confidence Interval (CI) since the upper limit was not calculable. The median and 95% CIs are now reported.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 24 months after study enrollment); amendment (up to 30 months after study enrollment)
outcome.population: Intent to treat population. Number of patients censored (up to 24 months): pemetrexed = 51, docetaxel = 55. Number of participants censored (up to 30 months): pemetrexed = 30, docetaxel = 32.

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from the date of study enrollment to the date of death due to any cause. Survival time was censored at the date of last contact for patients who were still alive or lost to follow-up. An amendment allowed for the collection of overall survival on an additional 43 survival events. At the time the original record was released, it was not possible to provide results with the 95% Confidence Interval (CI) since the upper limit was not calculable. The median and 95% CIs are now reported.
measure.population: Intent to treat population. Number of patients censored (up to 24 months): pemetrexed = 51, docetaxel = 55. Number of participants censored (up to 30 months): pemetrexed = 30, docetaxel = 32.

measurement_list.measurement: The upper limit of the 95% confidence interval was not calculable because an insufficient number of participants reached the event at the final time point for assessment.
The upper limit of the 95% confidence interval was not calculable because an insufficient number of participants reached the event at the final time point for assessment.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Disease Progression
outcome.description: Number of patients who have died or have had progression of disease. This outcome substitutes for the outcome on Duration of Response.
outcome.time_frame: time of response to progressive disease (up to 12 months)
outcome.population: Patients who qualified for response (met following criteria: histologic or cytologic diagnosis of NSCLC that was not amenable to curative therapy; no concurrent systemic chemotherapy; presence of measurable or evaluable disease). Patients censored: pemetrexed=6, docetaxel=3.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The primary outcome measure of this trial was designed to include pooled data. In addition, the results for the outcome on Duration of Response could not be presented due to the low number of patients being analyzed in the docetaxel group.
